document.masterDocTitle: A new species of the genus Zercon (Acari, Zerconidae) from Turkey

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: A new species of the genus Zercon (Acari, Zerconidae) from Turkey

heading.emphasis:
Key to the adults of the genus
Zercon
known from Turkey

paragraph.keyLead: 7 . Seta S 2 finely barbed and without hyaline tip ................................................................fragilis Urhan, 2001
8 . Seta S 3 not reaching margin of opisthonotum ...........................................................colligans Berlese, 1920
– Pores Po 3 anterior to the line connecting setae Z 4 –J 4 , seta Z 4 reaching posterior margin of opisthonotum 11

12 . Eight extra setae between the setal rows J–J and J–Z ........................................... trabzonensis
Urhan, 1997

19 . Long setae of opisthonotum thick and terminally broad ...........................................berlesei
Sellnıck, 1958
– Seta S 3 not reaching the margin of opisthonotum ................................................perforatulus Berlese, 1904
21 . Pores Po 3 between setal rows J–Z; outer dorsal pits twice as large as inner pits....................................... 22
– Pores Po 3 between setal rows Z–S; dorsal pits uniform in size ........................... montanus Wıllmann, 1943
22 . Seta J 3 not reaching the bases of seta J 4 .......................................................... cabylus Athıas-Henrıot, 1961

33 . Setae J 5 and Z 4 not reaching posterior margin of opisthonotum .............................. agnostus
Błaszak, 1979
– Setae J 5 and Z 4 reaching posterior margin of opisthonotum ......................................... salmani Urhan, 2002
